comment.text: Just had lunch at Seven Lamps for the first time and it was quite good.  We ordered the clam chowder, grilled octopus, the lobster roll, and raw oysters ( today they had bluepoints).  The oysters were good, I realize that Atlanta is landlocked so......although they were fresh, I know they still had a ways to travel to get to us.  The service was great! The only "concern" was the latest health inspection score.......that said,  I am not afraid to eat there again and will return but I had to say something because I saw the score.

Food, service and ambience were all present during a brunch at Seven Lamps on Sunday, February 18, 2024. What a wonderful, cozy little restaurant tucked in the Around Lenox shopping mall. The food was beautifully presented and delicious. You will see from the photos how lovely the table was and how color coordinated everything was with the flowers and drinks. We had mimosas, one with grapefruit and one with orange juice. The food was delicious and beautifully prepared and presented. I had fish tacos. They were really good. I could have eaten more, and the accompanying salad was perfect and so pretty, I didn't want to eat it, but I did! My lunch date had the oysters. She said they were excellent. The restaurant is small and the menu is somewhat limited, but they take reservations and you will enjoy the food. Parking is free at Around Lenox. Highly recommended. You will love it.

photos.caption: Fish tacos with a side salad. Excellent!

comment.text:
Me and my beautiful sister just stopped by to grab drinks before our meeting. We were definitely surprised to see that the restaurant was quite smaller than expected, but giving it a chance we came in with the open mind and we ended up grabbing a little snack as well. The drinks were nicely made. Something unique is that the bar was not somewhere you could sit but had a long table right in front of it for you to still get the feel.

Recommends:
- Pushin "P"
- Sean's secret sangria 
- Smoke Signal
- BGE SMOKED & FRIED WINGS

photos.caption: BGE SMOKED & FRIED WINGS & FRIED Plantains

user.name: Rae B.
user.address: Gonzalo Guerrero, Playa del Carmen, Mexico

comment.text:
Natural decor!
Plenty of parking
Seasonal menu. 
Meeko always recognizes me and is consistently professional, prompt and a sweetheart. She's a wonderful waitress
Food is delicious and fresh!

photos.caption: The seasonal menu with some staple options.
Smoked wings....smoked daily and out front!

comment.text: We came here on Halloween night and it was pretty empty so we were seated immediately. The waiters were dressed in costume which was fun! We started with the tuna tartare and the corn and jalapeño hush puppies. Both were absolutely excellent. The tartare was absolutely perfect. I had the teriyaki grilled chicken with coconut rice and pineapple pico de gallo. The rice was actually really good on its own until I bit into a ball of uncooked rice. The grilled chicken was fine. My partner had the grilled trout and it was delicious so I do recommend.

This little cute hidden spot is very nice. I love the atmosphere and the outdoor area. This is my second time visiting. My first time coming was AMAZING, so I came again. I forgot to write a review the first time so decided so would make sure I did this time.

The staff was extremely kind and very knowledgeable of the menu. My frozen Frose drink was the truth. I really recommend you try this. 

The only reason they are getting a 4 out of 5 stars is because the fish itself was very bland. It didn't have any flavor. The brussel sprouts this time were not crispy and done. They were very hard in the middle. We did order another order and asked them to cook them longer and they came out perfect. 

This review doesn't count them out because I still like the vibe and would definitely go back.
The food here is fantastic. I got the chicken. It did not disappoint. They have a cute little patio although it only overlooks the parking lot. The inside is vibey. Service was good.

This place was interesting. It's literally in a shopping center and has an open kitchen concept. We came around 3pm for a late lunch. The food was good, however not satisfying. The portions are small so not really ideal for sharing and you might want to order a couple dishes to fill you up. The hush puppies were awful and recommended by our waitress. It tasted super greasy and nothing like I expected. The only thing that really stood out to me was their espresso dessert. I'm not sure if they have a different menu but looking on Yelp, that's what it appears to be unless it's not updated. Oh yeah, they no longer have the fried okra!

I wound down my Atlanta visit with a lunch at Seven Lamps, which my brother highly recommended from his previous experience.  The hip space was tucked away in the corner of a strip mall, making it a hidden gem for those in the know.  While they had a nice outdoor patio, we decided to bask in the air conditioning of the indoor space.  The dining room had an industrial vibe with an open kitchen where we could watch the staff assemble our meal.

The menu was full of healthy, creative dishes, so we decided to order a few things and share them, in order to try more items.  The Avocado & Quinoa Salad was mainly an arugula and quinoa base, which was topped with very few pumpkin seeds, cucumbers, and radishes, as well as the aforementioned avocado slices.  While the salad was rather plain, even with its salsa verde vinaigrette, the Grilled Shrimp that we added were amazing!  The plump shellfish had a hint of smokiness, which was really interesting.  We also ordered the Mahi Mahi Ceviche, which was served in a glass containing layers of orange slices, an avocado mousse, and a ginger tequila aguachile.  It was a very refreshing rendition of a ceviche, but it would have been appreciated if the acidic blend was served with some sort of bread or crackers. Lastly, the Crispy Brussels Sprouts had been seasoned with apple cider vinegar and curry.  The sprouts were a bit overcooked for my liking, but the curry seasoning, as well as the toppings of peanuts and mint crema, added an unique flavor profile to what has often become a popular, mainstream dish.

Seven Lamps provided an innovative and enjoyable ending to our Atlanta adventure and would be worth seeking out in its concealed location.

photos.caption: Crispy Brussels Sprouts + Mahi Mahi Ceviche
Avocado & Quinoa Salad with Grilled Shrimp

comment.text:
Walked here from my hotel on Lenox. Super cute courtyard outdoor seating. 

I opted to sit inside at the bar. It's a unique bar that em either faces the actual bar or out into the restaurant and kitchen. I love watching the kitchen so their thing. This particular evening was quite busy with several large parties and it was exciting. 

Octopus was cooked well and pickled potatoes were great. 
Pasta was disappointing, but the mushrooms, tomatoes and corn were delicious. Noodles are vegan and I didn't realize this. Might not have ordered. 

Great ambiance, neat atmosphere.

Came here on a Monday and there were only a couple of tables occupied. It's in the same complex as the flower child and west elm so a big parking lot there. 

The food was great! Very fresh and flavorful and the service felt like fine dining almost. We ordered a lot of food and ended up having to take some home. Personal favorite was the wings. I loved the the sauce and seasoning on it. The charcuterie board was also a great starter. 

They do have a wine list and I had some as well. They have some great options.

We came here for lunch on a Friday and even though I had a reservation, it was not needed. There was plenty of seating, both inside and out on their shared patio. The location is in a shopping center and parking was easy. Our server was with us quickly to get our drink orders. We took a long time to order both because we were chatting and because there are so many good options.

We started with the pimento cheese board and it was excellent. There was a great variety of items on the board, so even if you don't like pimento. you will enjoy this board. We also got the corn and jalapeno hush puppies. These were great as well, with it being fried just the right amount. For my entree, I got the burger. The sweet onions were a nice touch, but I felt the bun was a bit dry. Other than that, I enjoyed my time here!

Went specifically for the Chef Table service where it offered a four course meal. During the time we went we had the inside of the restaurant to ourselves so it was perfect. Had there been others seated around us it would have taken away from the experience. The food was delicious and a great way to try different items as we had duck, pork and chicken options. Good selections were presented for the wine pairing although we may have enjoyed ordering four of our own drinks. However, the experience is worth letting the restaurant pick for you. Delicious brownie dessert with a coffee martini to close it out. The chef was nice and personable and came and explained each course. Our server Cam was great and very nice!

photos.caption: Chicken pot pie (delicious smoked chicken thigh)

comment.text:
This place has the coolest, cozy vibes and is a great (first) date spot! Think Anthropologie-esque but inviting, with string lights outside. Our waiter was attentive, checking on us regularly, and had great recommendations. We shared the smoked trout dip (delish homemade tortilla chips served with a smoked creamy dip and a side of pickled celery, 7/10) and the fried plantains (perfectly crispy and bite sized with a delicious glaze served atop a herb-y buttermilk ranch... YUM 10/10). I had the frozen piña colada, which was a perfect frozen consistency and fruity, but I'd probably try another cocktail next time, 7/10). Plus: it has FREE PARKING! Right outside, there is a large shopping center parking lot that's very accessible. 

Can't wait to check out brunch and dinner here... planning to become a regular!

Stumbled upon this place while shopping and, oh boy, am I glad we did!  The food? Amazing. Taste, portion size, plating--10/10. This restaurant has the distinct pleasure of entering into my Clean Plate Club. I think I even tried to eat the bone... Similarly, the cocktails were fabulous and well executed. Prices for both food and beverages were absolutely appropriate. 

Service was stellar, and while some might think the food and drink a tad slow to come out, I think it was absolutely appropriate for what we ordered. Good things take time! 

Loved the ambience as well. The interior was dimly lit and well designed, but you can still easily read the menu. 

If I'm ever back that way, I'd love to do the chefs table!!

What a great place for some amazing food that portrays culinary excellence. The steak was perfectly cooked medium rare like I requested. The fries were tossed in parsley and Parmesan cheese which were perfectly crispy as well. The octopus was nicely cooked, tender, and packed so much flavor. The service was outstanding as our waiter was very attentive towards us . The ambiance of the place was very nice having the alcohol wall.

On a business trip in ATL and this restaurant was within walking distance to my hotel. I was skeptical at first, being that it was next to a mall, but everything changed when we were seated. Great music, dimly lit, tasty menu. Started with an old fashioned paired with some hush puppies and octopus appetizer. Then moved onto a bottle of red wine paired with a steak which was incredible. 

Our server, Jenna, knocked it out of the park. Fantastic recommendations, great conversation, & provided us with perfect service. Would come back again.

My coworker and I came here for lunch. They have an open kitchen and were seated in front of. I usually love this but with the heat lately it was too warm for my liking. We started with the shrimp in sauce with Texas toast which was amazing. I ordered the chicken panini which I ended up eating with fork and knife for the bread was ver thick. My coworker had the salmon as recommended from our server. He said it was just ok and the fried zucchini on plate was ice cold in the middle.

The evening was my first time at the restaurant. A little impromptu girls night/ pre birthday festivities. The atmosphere was nice it wasn't packed which I appreciated.

I ordered the plantains and the burger with a side of the bacon jam

My friends ordered the Brussels sprouts, the chicken, and the pimento cheese plate.

The plantains were fried to perfection. 

The burger was a medium and juicy which I liked, I want.a fan of the bun though which had black sesame seeds on it. 

The pimento cheese player was a hit with my friends. The Brussels were nice had a crisp but I do wish they had more crisp to them. 

I also ordered a gimme cocktail and it was tasty, it had the potential to be a sneak up on you type cocktail.

photos.caption: Pimento cheese plate with pickled veggies, pink grape fruit butter and bacon jam on the pimento cheese

comment.text: I enjoyed my lunch here. Spence (I believe that was the bartender's name) was very friendly, but very busy. The restaurant set up inside the restaurant is kind of awkward. It's located in a perfect location in Buckhead. My cocktails where delicious. My food came out fresh and how I asked. I order the "Burger with French fries" and my guest ordered the Fish sandwich with French fries. I think we enjoyed our meal pretty well.
Very good food and great service.  Nothing else to say, so I'm just trying to make the review 85 characters
So far the appetizers are delicious.  Love the ambiance. Our host Chris is the best. So polite, his recommendations were spot on.

One of my favorite places for dinner and/or drinks in Atlanta. Anytime someone is in town to visit, I bring them to Seven Lamps. It's in such a convenient location, the menu (both food and drink) is great and always delivers, the ambiance is perfect-- even if you want to sit outside by the heat lamps when it gets chilly out -- and the service is quality.

Again, nothing on the menu has disappointed me to this point (and I've been probably close to a dozen times now) but the salmon, chicken, burger, brussels sprouts, fries and clams are all highlights.

We sat outside on a Tuesday night. Service was fine in terms of speed but didn't feel very welcomed to be there as first time guests. Oysters were good. The chicken teriyaki was a bit salty and the chicken was not as tender as I would have liked. My partner felt similarly about his dish. We would consider coming back to try new things but it isn't likely.

Well, where can I start? This is now our go to spot for my wife and me when we need some "Passion"! The "Gimme" Passion drink is my favorite craft cocktail that they offer and no one makes it better than my favorite barkeep, Jenna. She was so personable, and attended to our every need. Even one of the chefs, Chef Wes, gave me the low down on an amazing dish (the Georgia Royal Red Shrimp - yum!). All in all, whenever we need a good drink and a great atmosphere, this place does it for me. The Burger is always good and the Smoked Wings kill every night. If you want that "smoke", come over to Seven Lamps.

Nice relaxing atmosphere. We went at 8:30 pm so there was low lighting candle lit at table. 

 I originally ordered the salmon patty but boy it was charred so bad. It was burnt, so I sent it back and got the salmon and grits instead. The salmon in the grits was a little less charred. It tasted better. The relish jam was made of jalapeños, red green yellow peppers and red onion; it was a yummy touch. I ordered a mock passion fruit Moscow mule to drink. They make their ginger beer in house and it's sooo strong /spicy. I really enjoyed it though. The service was 10/10 no complaints.

Stumbled upon this place in search for sustenance while out of town.  Was pleasantly surprised with this spot- it's unique, spacious and they're cranking out quality meals.  I didn't get a chance to take a pic of mine, too busy eating.  But I did snap a pic of my love's.  He gave it a thumbs up.

Went for brunch. the carafe of joy (St Germaine, champagne, grapefruit, lime and rosemary) and had no regrets. Well I regretted getting a glass instead of a whole carafe. The shrimp and grits were delightful. The fries were amazing. Also liked the pimiento cheese board.
jay was so so amazing!! she made our experience so fun and gave us the best recommendations. make sure to ask for her espresso martini literally the best i've ever had.. ;)

I read tons of reviews and noticed the high ranking of stars so I just knew this was the restaurant to visit. When I arrived, my party was seated outdoors on a beautiful day to accommodate our size. So far everything was going great. We ordered drinks and appetizers. Our waitress brought out a round of drinks and water, but before she left, she dumped the access liquid from her tray on to the ground in between our table and another parties table. I looked up in disbelief. Who would dump anything out on the ground near dining patrons? 

Next we requested straws to drink from our glasses and were brought out several straws in her barehand. When this happened I immediately asked that she bring us covered straws as we were not going to use straws and place them in our beverages after being directly in her hands. The third strike was I ordered a burger and it was paired with hand cut fries, but the fries were burnt and the burger wasn't seasoned or flavorful nor does the restaurant provide regular ketchup. The ketchup paired with this dish is a house ketchup which if I'm being 100% honest, is not tasty at all. Two of us ordered burgers and we both sent back the fries for the same issue.

Now I rated my experience a two because even though several things happened that made me write this restaurant off, there were some positives. The waitress brought out new fries that were freshly made and were not burnt. The lamb, shrimp, and okra were delicious dishes and the kids loved the chicken tenders. There were just so many things I didn't enjoy that I probably won't be back, but if you go get those three things I mentioned, you won't be disappointed, but can't promise the service will be any better.

I really wanted to love this place and give it 4 stars but when you add up all the things it's was not a 4 star rounded experience. 

There were 9 of us for dinner. 2 vegetarians and 3 non drinkers the bill was just under $900. 

Food: very mixed reviews 
Portion sizes varied significantly depending on the dish you ordered. 

Appetizers 
Fried okra: 2* it was a bit slimy inside
 
Fries: 5*had a great crisp to them. If you enjoy dipping sauces they came with 3 that the group enjoyed. We actually ordered another round 

Octopus: 2* it was too chewy on one end and the other was a bit over cooked 

Meals 
Special order lamb with succotash. 3* The Lamb was over cooked at medium but so glad I got the succotash as it was a highlight of the dish. My colleague had the lamb as it was supposed to be prepared and she wad def underwhelmed; hers was also over cooked. 

Smoked pork chop: 4* was excellent but no one liked the sides with it. We had it with 
Over all the food was inconsistent in the cook and flavors. 
Both of our vegetarian dishes which has the be special orders did not come out as requested. 


Atmosphere 4
-nice place for a dateif they could figure out food and service. 


Service Mixed 
- drink service was very slow even 
- almost every dish that had a change was inaccurate. Attention to detail is important when you have dietary requests.
Cute restaurant and the staff was very polite! My lobster roll and side salad was good as well!

photos.caption: Maine Lobster Roll w/ a side salad

comment.text:
This place is amazing! My husband and I stumbled upon it one day and we're so glad we did. 

The food is amazing. We've enjoyed what we thought would be basic dishes burgers and fries, which turned out to be are anything but ordinary, The smoky wings are also delicious. In a nutshell, we haven't had anything that wasn't delicious, thanks to Chef Wes (who also stopped by our table our table last time to check on us). 

I can't say enough about the cocktails! The last time we went, Jenna made us both a drink called Gimme Passion, and it is by far the best drink I've ever had. Jenna was also our server and was so accommodating and friendly, which you'll also find amongst all the staff. 

The ambience, whether it is afternoon or evening, is amazing. It's great for dates,  brunch with your girlfriends or hanging  with your friends for a very chill time. 

I highly recommend this place!

Seven lamps is a great spot for a nice dinner with friends and family! Located in the shops around Lenox, seven lamps is nestled in a corner so it's a little hard to find, but look for west elm and flower child.

We had a party of 4 and were seated instantly. Our waitress was awesome and was super attentive and had our drinks and food out super fast. I had the pork tenderloin with bean ragu and vegetables on top. All of the food tasted amazing, the only critique I have is the pork was a little undercooked.

Overall, seven lamps was great and I'd definitely like to come back in the future!

Seven Lamps is a cozy, little restaurant located in the shopping center across from Lenox Square Mall. The signage is not very noticeable from the street but it's right next to Kendra Scott. I stopped in for a solo weekday lunch and was pleasantly greeted by the host. The restaurant was semi-busy and I opted to sit at the high-top table. The tables are long and are designed as shared European-style seating. Luckily, I came at the perfect time to have the whole high-top to myself. I can imagine it may be awkward to dine here for a date night or intimate dinner on a crowded night. 

They offer an extensive, customized menu with some unique offerings. I opted for the spicy Maine mussels with andouille sausage. It came with about 25 mussels and a tasty tomatillo sauce and onions. I was a bit disappointed with the andouille sausage since it was a very small amount but overall, the mussels had a rich flavor and a nice spicy kick to it. The service was excellent and prices are fair.
This place felt like a hidden gem. The food was fantastic. The ambiance was awesome. And Jenna at the bar was amazing!

We had the pleasure of dinning with Jenna this evening and everything was so so delicious!! We ordered the half oysters and wings to start, and were not disappointed. Our cocktails were tasty and really complimented our entrees. I ordered the cat fish tacos and my partner the bbq salmon, both kept this tasty momentum going. Finished it up with a delectable banana pudding which was neither too sweet nor too plain, it was perfect! Service was a 10/10 experience and the music really set the tone for a wonderful dinner. Will be back.

Seven lamps is one of our favorite restaurants in the area. From the cocktails to the food there is no lack of flavor and finesse. 

We almost always get the pimento cheese plate to start. 

The burger there is absolutely amazing. This time we tried the chicken salad sandwich and the Buffalo chicken. My hubs actually got to his sandwich but I filled up on the cheese plate and ended up saving my sandwich for later. 

You can't go wrong with anything at Seven Lamps. 

The aesthetic is swanky there. Great date night spot.

We always thank our friends at Yelp for providing a platform to share the Voice of the Customer.
Let's talk about Seven Lamps...
This was my second time and they have not disappointed. The first time was a large group and the second was a more intimate gathering. 
Seven Lamps is a cute restaurant located in the armpit of the Buckhead shops near Lenox Mall in Atlanta next door to West Elm. 
It was a beautiful Sunday so we decided to eat outside on the patio. The service was good as well as the food and libations. I would definitely recommend Seven Lamps any day of the week. It offers a cute indoor or outdoor setting with various options on the menu.

Danesha! Danesha! Danesha!  

Yes, the food is good at Seven Lamps.  I recommend trying a small plate such as the hush puppies and pumpkin hummus and save room for the bread pudding for dessert but The real reason I'm reviewing this restaurant is for the impeccable service we received from Danesha.  

There's a difference between someone who waits tables and a professional server. Danesha is a professional server.  She radiated goodness as she approached our table and took the time to provide recommendations on the menu.  She came back to check on us but wasn't over bearing.  With each approach back to our table, she brought good energy with her.  I don't have enough good things to say about her.  She's that good!

If you eat at this restaurant, ask for Danesha.  It will be the best choice you make all day.

Jay was the best server i've ever had (she's also the bartender and was so helpful deciding drinks). she's so conversational, helpful and gave us dessert for free because im leaving the country. she deserves a RAISE! food was pretty great as well! i personally think the lobster roll could have had more lobster and less celery. but the rest of our food was outstanding. this experience made me want to stay in america and hangout with jay everyday. 9.5/10

We were pleasantly surprised by how great the quality of execution of flavor was! We came during the midday, between brunch and dinner, so the menu was quite limited. Nonetheless, the wings were hands down some of the absolute best i have had in atlanta....smoked then fried!? Whew!! You taste the smokiness through and through, while the skin is not "soggy" with sauce. A+ guys!

As buckhead residents, we will certainly be back during a dinner or brunch full menu.

Great service and great food lol was a little hangover that day but I did enjoy the food lol I miss it and can't wait to go back. I  kept this review short because it's food was great and the service! Everyone was so friendly!

We visited for the first time. Sat on the patio. Our server was attentive. He was really knowledgeable and provided great menu recommendations. We shared several small plates - brussel sprouts, Georgia shrimp, fried wings , plantains and the picanha. 

Everything was so delicious. Definitely elevated comfort food.  Will definitely be back soon
Good good overall, must say the brownie dessert was amazing! Although service was a bit lacking, the ambiance still is the same as it's always been! Love 7 lamps'

Seven Lamps seems like a hole-in-the-wall restaurant, you can easily miss it where it is located, but WHAT A GEM! We met for dinner with friends on a Saturday night and had a really positive experience. We really wanted to sit outside and enjoy our last few nights of summer in September. The outdoor seating was covered by individual umbrellas and the weather was perfect. I appreciated their short but flavorful-sounding menu. They have some nice mixed cocktails on the menu as well. 

For the table we ordered - (2) orders of the Georgia Royal Red Shrimp (omg the brioche was amazing, never thought of eating it like that), an order or Brussell sprouts, and individually I ordered the smoked duck, my husband ordered the chicken, and our friends got the pork tenderloin, and salmon. Everyone really enjoyed their food and raved about how excellent the meal was. But my meal - the smoked duck with curry, sweet potato, and plantains is where it's at. Duck is generally pretty oily to me, but I loved my serving at Seven Lamps. 

I love that the menu seems to always change and they don't have the same thing all the time. The service was good and they played good music the whole night. All in all, we had a great time and will definitely be back.

Just a great overall experience, so came away highly recommending this place after a very tasty and well prepped Sunday brunch.  I had 2 spicy Bloody Maries, the Chicken & Biscuit, and left wanting more.  Excellent food, incredible service, and a great ambiance.

Eat & Drink Here!

Jenna 
Our dress very "patron user friendly. Come n sit outside and u may even sit next to a fellow foodie then the meal gets better

photos.caption: My server did us impeccably. Y'all better keep her... enjoyed the smoked chicken wings, plantains and quinoa avocado salad.

comment.text:
We stopped in for lunch a little before 3pm on Saturday. We were seated pretty quickly after the hostess wiped down the table. Can't say the same for the chairs which seemed to have some type of glitter on them.  And this was probably the highlight of the service for the afternoon.  We were seated for about 15 minutes before someone came to our table to take our drink order only to find out it was the waitress that was next to us chatting up the couple at that table.  By that time we had already looked at the menu and knew what we wanted so we ordered everything at once. We ordered fried plantains for an appetizer ($10); the burger and fries ($18); and Springer Mountain farms chicken breast w/ fingerling potatoes ($24). And then more waiting. We watched while our waitress floated around like a social butterfly mostly talking to her coworkers and seemingly flirting with one of the cooks. That was when we could see her in the main dining area. Apparently she was also at the bar at some point helping to make drinks per one of the other servers we finally asked after waiting more than 15 minutes to get the check.  When she eventually came to the table we asked her for the check directly and she still didn't immediately go over to the register to print it.  More social time.  We got it about 10 minutes later and it included two items we didn't ordered that were added and then credited back at the bottom of the ticket. This bad service really overshadowed the food. The plantains were a bit greasy. The chicken's presentation looked good but the flavors were not very good or complimentary of the chicken. 
Per my husband the burger was a standout and was seasoned to perfection, although it was well done and not cooked medium as he requested. Not worth a return visit.

photos.caption: Fried plantains with spicy sorgum glaze, aji verde, cotija
Springer Mountain farms chicken breast with fingerling potatoes, local greens, roasted garlic, salsa verde

comment.text: Great place, service and food! Only reason for a missing star is lack of variety on the menu. If you like the options they have I would say go for it! There were about 6 entree options total and 3 were seafood, so it you aren't a seafood eater not many options. We got the pimento cheese tray, chicken and burger and spilt our entrees.
